post.content:
I recently installed Windows 2000 on my computer at work. Since then, I can not write in Korean although there is no problem reading Korean.
I used to use MS Global IME on Win NT. But I cannot install the software on Win2K. It says... "Thie version of Global IME cannot be installed on this version of Windows".
So, I checked MS download site and found newest one "Global IME for Office XP". But then, this one requires "Office XP" which I don't have.
Does anyone know how to write Korean on Win2K? What software do I need to install?
Thanks!
